rename.to: RFC - Bleve v1.0.0 and Go Modules

issue.title: Improve large segment waste

repository.name: bleve
repository.description: A modern text/numeric/geo-spatial/vector indexing library for go

issue.body:
Do not merge to master, this is attempt for me to rebase @sreekanth-cb's PR onto latest master.  In the meantime @steveyen had introduce the MemUvarIntReader thing, so I attempted to blend the two.

Please do not laugh too hard, and review carefully.

issue.title: go get error with bbolt

repository.name: bleve
repository.description: A modern text/numeric/geo-spatial/vector indexing library for go

issue.body:
go get github.com/blevesearch/bleve

error:
```
go: github.com/blevesearch/bleve imports
        github.com/blevesearch/bleve/index/scorch imports
        github.com/etcd-io/bbolt: github.com/etcd-io/bbolt@v1.3.4: parsing go.mod:
        module declares its path as: go.etcd.io/bbolt
                but was required as: github.com/etcd-io/bbolt
```

Notice there's a [pr 1357](https://github.com/blevesearch/bleve/pull/1357) for this.

body:
Thank you all for your feedback.  We have not received any negative feedback on this proposal, and we feel confident moving forward.

This weekend, we will be executing the plan.  We hope this goes smoothly, but please understand that due to some circular dependencies, you may notice some temporary issues.  All repos will be tagged prior to making changes.

Our hope is that all everything is resolved by Monday morning at the latest.  If you encounter problems, do not hesitate to open an issue.

issue.title: Support go.mod

repository.name: bleve
repository.description: A modern text/numeric/geo-spatial/vector indexing library for go

issue.body:
Hello,
We use go 1.11 (go.mod) and since some of your transitive dependencies have started to use it too.
When we `go mod tidy` your transitive dependencies follow and we can never be sure that updating them will not have an impact on bleve.

It would be great that you lock the stable dependencies for a tagged version of bleve....

issue.title: Failed to install with zap error

repository.name: bleve
repository.description: A modern text/numeric/geo-spatial/vector indexing library for go

issue.body:
go version go1.12.6 darwin/amd64
```
go get github.com/blevesearch/bleve/...
package github.com/blevesearch/bleve
        imports github.com/blevesearch/zap/v11: cannot find package "github.com/blevesearch/zap/v11" in any of:
        /usr/local/go/src/github.com/blevesearch/zap/v11 (from $GOROOT)
        /*/go/src/github.com/blevesearch/zap/v11 (from $GOPATH)
```
Couldn't find zap folder ?

issue.title: Can't build the package

repository.name: bleve-explorer
repository.description: An example app providing an HTTP/REST/JSON front-end to bleve

issue.body:
build fails on 2 dependencies 
```
# github.com/couchbase/moss
../../../../pkg/mod/github.com/couchbase/moss@v0.0.0-20190322010551-a0cae174c498/api.go:176:15: undefined: ghistogram.Histograms
../../../../pkg/mod/github.com/couchbase/moss@v0.0.0-20190322010551-a0cae174c498/collection.go:98:13: undefined: ghistogram.Histograms
# github.com/blevesearch/bleve-mapping-ui
../../../../pkg/mod/github.com/blevesearch/bleve-mapping-ui@v0.1.0/mapping.go:105:13: undefined: bleve.IndexMapping
```

issue.title: go get failure

repository.name: bleve
repository.description: A modern text/numeric/geo-spatial/vector indexing library for go

issue.body:
When I ran `go get github.com/blevesearch/bleve`, I received the following output:

```
PS C:\Users\User\go\src\github.com\xoviat\xap> go get github.com/blevesearch/bleve    
package github.com/blevesearch/zap/v11: cannot find package "github.com/blevesearch/zap/v11" in any of:
        c:\go\src\github.com\blevesearch\zap\v11 (from $GOROOT)
        C:\Users\User\go\src\github.com\blevesearch\zap\v11 (from $GOPATH)
package github.com/blevesearch/zap/v12: cannot find package "github.com/blevesearch/zap/v12" in any of:
        c:\go\src\github.com\blevesearch\zap\v12 (from $GOROOT)
        C:\Users\User\go\src\github.com\blevesearch\zap\v12 (from $GOPATH)
package github.com/blevesearch/zap/v13: cannot find package "github.com/blevesearch/zap/v13" in any of:
        c:\go\src\github.com\blevesearch\zap\v13 (from $GOROOT)
        C:\Users\User\go\src\github.com\blevesearch\zap\v13 (from $GOPATH)
PS C:\Users\User\go\src\github.com\xoviat\xap>
```

I haven't had problems installing other go packages. I could download these files manually, but wanted to know why they weren't downloaded automatically by the command.

issue.title: add support for zap v15 and update zap version

repository.name: bleve
repository.description: A modern text/numeric/geo-spatial/vector indexing library for go

issue.title: How to add bleve to existing codbase?

repository.name: bleve
repository.description: A modern text/numeric/geo-spatial/vector indexing library for go

issue.body:
I'd like to add bleve to an exising codebase which does NOT user go modules. 
On the other hand in the documentations I read 

```
The simplest way to get started with bleve is to create a new module:

go mod init <your application>
```


So I'm wondering how can I still install bleve in this circumstances?

body:
here is a go.mod in bleve folder

`cat /home/pi/go/src/github.com/blevesearch/bleve/go.mod
module github.com/blevesearch/bleve/v2

go 1.13

require (
	github.com/RoaringBitmap/roaring v0.4.23
	github.com/blevesearch/bleve_index_api v1.0.0
	github.com/blevesearch/go-porterstemmer v1.0.3
	github.com/blevesearch/scorch_segment_api/v2 v2.0.1
	github.com/blevesearch/segment v0.9.0
	github.com/blevesearch/snowballstem v0.9.0
	github.com/blevesearch/upsidedown_store_api v1.0.1
	github.com/blevesearch/vellum v1.0.3
	github.com/blevesearch/zapx/v11 v11.2.0
	github.com/blevesearch/zapx/v12 v12.2.0
	github.com/blevesearch/zapx/v13 v13.2.0
	github.com/blevesearch/zapx/v14 v14.2.0
	github.com/blevesearch/zapx/v15 v15.2.0
	github.com/couchbase/moss v0.1.0
	github.com/golang/protobuf v1.3.2
	github.com/kljensen/snowball v0.6.0
	github.com/rcrowley/go-metrics v0.0.0-20190826022208-cac0b30c2563
	github.com/spf13/cobra v0.0.5
	github.com/steveyen/gtreap v0.1.0
	github.com/syndtr/goleveldb v1.0.0
	github.com/willf/bitset v1.1.10
	go.etcd.io/bbolt v1.3.5
	golang.org/x/text v0.3.0
)
`
So go.mod is there but bleve still complains that it cannot find zapx.
At this point I have no idea how to compile it.
maybe should look at some kind of alternative...
